resources.string: What is a regular expression\nA regular expression (or regex for short) is a sequence of characters that define a search pattern.

What is Regex Golf\nRegex golf is about finding a pattern that matches the words in the left column but doesn\'t match the ones in the right.\nThe goal is to use the least amount of characters to create such a regex, much like you try to hit the ball into the hole in golf using the least amount of strokes.

Single character
Simply writing a character or a string of characters means a word contains what you wrote.
Using brackets you can define alternatives.
gr[ae]y matches both gray and grey.
Dashes help you shorten large groups of alternatives.
dun[e-k] matches dune, dung, and dunk.
Use the dot character the define wildcards that match any one character.
t.n matches tan, tin, ton, etc.

Multiple characters
Quantifiers come in three kinds, but they are all associated with the element they follow.
 * matches the preceding element zero or more times.
For example, ab*c matches ac, abc, abbbc, etc.
 + is similar to * but it forces at least one match.
So ab+c wouldn't match ac, but it would match all the others from the previous example.
Double tap on any topic to expand it
